intro: Batidophaca gilensis, commonly known as the Gilan batidophaca, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Gilan Province in Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Its blooming period typically occurs in late spring, attracting a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
